trans-unit.source: Represents a row within a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
The DetailsViewRow class is used to represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control has a designated row type.
The following table lists the row types that are valid for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control when there are no records to display.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType>|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| To determine the row type of a DetailsViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowType%2A> property.
A DetailsViewRow object also has a state associated with it.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.

|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState>|The DetailsViewRow object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState>|The DetailsViewRow object is in edit mode.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState>|The DetailsViewRow object is in insert mode.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState>|The DetailsViewRow object is in its normal (default) state.| To determine the state of a DetailsViewRow object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control stores all its data rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection.
To determine the index of a DetailsViewRow object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the DetailsViewRow object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property.
If a cell contains controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property specified.

To retrieve a field value from a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BoundField> field column or an automatically generated field column, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property of the cell.

To retrieve a field value from other field column types where the field value is bound to a control, first retrieve the control from the appropriate cell and then access the appropriate property of the control.
> [!NOTE] > It is possible to use a data-binding expression directly in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplateField> field column without binding the value to a property of a control.
In this case, the field value is automatically placed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control.

To retrieve the field value, you must first retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl> control from the appropriate cell and then use its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataBoundLiteralControl.Text%2A> property.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DetailsViewRow class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> class.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowIndex%2A>|The value specified by the `itemIndex` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowType%2A>|The value specified by the `rowType` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow.RowState%2A>|The value specified by the `rowState` parameter.|
The index of the row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows*> collection of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> enumeration values.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Determines whether to pass an event up the page's ASP.NET server control hierarchy.
The source of the event.
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the event has been canceled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets the index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows*> collection of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.

Use the RowIndex property to determine the index of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data rows.

The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Rows*> collection of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the RowState property to determine the state of the row.
The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.

|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Alternate`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is an alternate row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.| This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowState"></xref> enumeration values.
Gets the row type of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow"></xref> object.
Use the RowType property to determine the type of row that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewRow> object represents.
The following table lists the valid row type values.

|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowType.DataRow`|A data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow`|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control when there are no records to display.| |`DataControlRowType.Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.| This property is commonly used to determine a row's type before performing an operation.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataControlRowType"></xref> values.
